item.title: Tunc add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Show me a family of readers, and I will show you the people who move the world." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Tunc add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Live a good life. If there are gods and they are just, then they will not care how devout you have been, but will welcome you based on the virtues you have lived by. If there are gods, but unjust, then you should not want to worship them. If there are no gods, then you will be gone, but will have lived a noble life that will live on in the memories of your loved ones." -- Anonymous

item.title: Tunc add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Tunc add a quote by Emperor Charles V
item.description: "To God I speak Spanish, to women Italian, to men French, and to my horse - German." -- Emperor Charles V

item.title: Tunc add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "This agglomeration which was called and which still calls itself the Holy Roman Empire was neither holy, nor Roman, nor an empire." -- Voltaire
